channel.title: New Urban Legends
channel.description: Recent additions to the Urban Legends Reference Pages at snopes.com
channel.copyright: Copyright 2005 by Barbara and David P. Mikkelson

image.title: Urban Legends Reference Pages
image.description: The definitive Internet reference source for urban legends, folklore, myths, rumors, and misinformation.

item.title: Raisin Hopes
item.description: Will a daily regimen of ingesting gin-soaked raisins help relieve arthritis symptoms?
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: Turning Japanese
item.description: Was the nationality of Kato, the Green Hornet's valet, abruptly changed after the beginning of World War II?
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: Crash Course
item.description: Does a rise in automobile accidents occur in the aftermath of the Super Bowl?
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: Resign of the Times
item.description: Did an employee of Zantex Computers pen a scathing resignation letter?
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: Microsoft Impersonation Scam
item.description: Fraud alert: Scammers pretending to be Microsoft techs call victims and offer to fix viruses on their computers.
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.description: The year 2011 produces some dates with unusual combinations of 1's, and other tricks.
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: Kentucky State Welfare
item.description: Does a new Kentucky law require that public assistance recipients pass a drug testing program?
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: 809 Area Code Scam
item.description: Scam alert warns that unsuspecting phone customers are being gulled into placing calls to area codes in the Caribbean that result in hefty charges.
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: Brown Out
item.description: Lawyer received a caustic response after complaining to the Cleveland Browns about fans' throwing paper airplanes.
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: Letter of Intent
item.description: Woman narrowly misses becoming the latest victim of a gang of murderers in World War II Berlin.
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: Blue Collar Innovation
item.description: Low-level employee suggests simple yet brilliant innovation that increases the profits of a successful company many times over.
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: The Great Stork Derby
item.description: A wealthy Toronto lawyer bequeathed his estate to whichever woman gave birth to the most babies in the ten-year period following his death.
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: 2011 California Traffic Ticket Fines
item.description: List details fines for violations of California vehicle codes taking effect in 2011.
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: Snub Par
item.description: Rumor: Prince William and Kate Middleton dislike the Obamas and "snubbed" them by not inviting them to their upcoming wedding.
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: Dead Like Me
item.description: Did the author of 'Black Like Me' die from skin cancer caused by the treatment he underwent to darken his skin?
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: The Seven Year Glitch
item.description: Does chewing gum take seven years to pass through your digestive system?
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: National Motto Letter
item.description: Members of the Congressional Prayer Caucus sent President Obama a letter correcting his reference to E pluribus unum as the U.S. national motto.
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: Jury Duty Scam
item.description: Identity thieves trick victims into revealing their personal details by telling them they've failed to report for jury duty and that warrants are being issued for their arrest.
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: Targeted for Crime
item.description: Is a rapist prowling a Target store parking lot and using an elderly woman in distress to lure his victims?
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: An August Event
item.description: Will July 2011 include five Fridays, five Saturdays, and five Sundays, a phenomenon that occurs only once every 800+ years?
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: Spokeo
item.description: Is your personal information viewable through the Spokeo aggregator site?
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: In Defense of Prayer
item.description: Did news commentator Andy Rooney write an essay in defense of prayer?
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: The Ring of Truth
item.description: Did President Obama stop wearing his wedding ring and wristwatch in observance of the Islamic holy month of Ramadan?
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: Stress Cards
item.description: Are military recruits issued "stress cards" they can present to drill sergeants who are giving them a hard time?
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: Facebook Closure
item.description: Will Facebook be closing down for good on 15 March 2011?
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: Copped Car
item.description: Must you yield your vehicle to a policeman who requests its use to chase a suspect?
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: Shirley, You Jest!
item.description: Did Cindy Williams write an article critical of military pay raises?
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: Charnel No. 5
item.description: Have seven people died from anthrax contracted through detergent samples sent to them in the mail?
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: Foreign Exchange
item.description: Are overseas call centers required to transfer customers to U.S.-based representatives upon request?
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: Loan Arrangers
item.description: Are congressional staffers and family members exempt from repaying their student loans?
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: Saved the Whale
item.description: Photograph purportedly shows a formerly ensnared whale thanking one of her rescuers.
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: F-35 Vertical Takeoff Flip
item.description: Video clip purportedly shows an F-35 executing a vertical flip on takeoff.
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: New Year's Danger
item.description: Is New Year's the day of the year on which the most people are killed in automobile accidents?
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: The Crickets
item.description: Did Buddy Holly's group name themselves "The Crickets" because the sound of a chirping cricket accidentally appeared on one of their recordings?
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: Lift and Separate
item.description: How a doctor was decapitated by a malfunctioning elevator.
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: Into the Void
item.description: A lottery ticket that would have won $30 million was voided because the buyer didn't want it.
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: No Colonel of Truth
item.description: Did Colonel Sanders' will direct Kentucky Fried Chicken to give money to the KKK?
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: I'll Care If ...
item.description: An "I'll care if..." polemic is attributed to the relative of a soldier serving in Iraq or one of various housewives.
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: Birthday of Reckoning
item.description: Actor Humphrey Bogart was born on Christmas Day -- truth or Hollywood legend?
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: Life Savers
item.description: Was Life Savers candy so named because the inventor's daughter died from choking on a mint?
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: Christmas Stalking
item.description: Did a fired department store Santa gain revenge by spelling out a crude message in lights?
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: Suicide Packed
item.description: Did a girl kill herself after her father posted something awful on her Facebook wall?
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: Coat Check
item.description: Baby left on bed is smothered under coats dropped by guests.
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: Westfield Mall Abduction
item.description: Crime alert warns that an attempted abduction took place at the Westfield Mall in Toledo.
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: Rudolph the Red-Nosed Reindeer
item.description: Was Rudolph the Red-Nosed Reindeer created by a father to bring comfort to his daughter as her mother was dying of cancer?
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: The Red and the Mondegreen
item.description: Misheard lyrics to Christmas songs are immortalized as 'mondegreens.'
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: Marine Layer
item.description: Shoplifter purportedly stabbed a Marine who was collecting Toys for Tots, then was whomped by other Marines.
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: Inn Discreet
item.description: A nativity play takes an unusual turn when the young boy playing the innkeeper departs from the script.
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: Cash Cropped
item.description: Mix-up with Christmas cards results in embarrassing faux pas.
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: Derek Wyatt
item.description: Facebook appeal seeks to honor the memory of fallen U.S. Marine Corporal Derek Wyatt.
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: Melba Toasted
item.description: Were melba toast and peach melba named for an opera singer?
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: Let's Say Thanks
item.description: The web site LetsSayThanks.com allows the public to send free personalized postcards to U.S. troops serving overseas.
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: Cleaning for a Reason
item.description: Cleaning for a Reason offers free cleaning services to women undergoing treatment for cancer.
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: Muslims Out of Australia!
item.description: Article purportedly compiles statements from Australian government officials about Sharia law and Muslim extremists.
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: Electronic Pickpocketing
item.description: Can card-skimming thieves read information from RFID-enabled credit cards carried in pockets and purses?
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: Adobe PDF Reader Upgrade
item.description: E-mail phishing scam poses as notification for Adobe PDF Reader software upgrades.
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: Hammy Hanukkah!
item.description: Photograph purportedly shows a store advertising "Delicious for Chanukah" hams.
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: Facebook Cartoon Characters
item.description: Will changing your Facebook profile pic to that of a cartoon character combat child abuse? Or will it aid a pedophile?
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: Clip Joint
item.description: Video clip purportedly shows Barack Obama acknowledging that he is not a natural-born U.S. citizen.
item.author: snopes@snopes.com

item.title: Come Fly with Me
item.description: Was an air traveler arrested after ejaculating during a TSA patdown?
item.author: snopes@snopes.com
